discussion.content:
Depending on the group member types available in your org, public groups can be a combination of:
individual users
roles
roles and subordinates
territories
territories and subordinates
other public groups

Selected Answer: B

questions.question_text: Public groups can be any combination of other public groups, users, roles and ________.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
File Storage is used for documents, attachments, Salesforce Files, and content stored in libraries.

Selected Answer: A
Files count towards storage charges.

It counts towards the file storage type. 
answer is A.
Data Storage
Starting in late March 2019, Contact Manager, Group, Essentials, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited Editions are allocated 10 GB for data storage, plus incrementally added user storage. For example, a Professional Edition org with 10 users receives 10 GB of data storage, plus 200 MB, for 10.2 GB of total data storage.

File Storage
Contact Manager, Group, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited Editions are allocated 10 GB of file storage per org. Essentials edition is allocated 1 GB of file storage per org."
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.overview_storage.htm&type=5
I recant my comment.... File Storage is the Documents Tab

Answer is A
In Saleforce.com you have two types of storage – File and Data. File storage includes attachments, items you've upload into the Documents tab, and Salesforce CRM Content. Everything else, including activities, is considered a record and counts towards your Data Storage allocation.Jun 22, 2010

Selected Answer: A
File attachments, document tabs, and sales force content count towards Data Storage

comments.content:
The answer is 'False' 
File storage includes: 
files in attachments, Files home, Salesforce CRM Content, Chatter files (including user photos), the Documents tab, the custom File field on Knowledge articles, and Site.com assets. 
Data storage includes the following:
Accounts, Article types (format: “[Article Type Name]”), Article type translations (format: “[Article Type Name] Version”), Campaigns, Campaign Members, Cases, Case Teams, Contacts, Contracts, Custom objects, Email messages, Events, Forecast items, Google docs, Ideas, Leads, List Email, Notes, Opportunities, Opportunity Splits, Orders, Quotes, Quote Template Rich Text Data, Solutions, Tags: Unique tags, Tasks, All objects tied to Field Service Lightning enablement

questions.question_text: File attachments, document tabs, and sales force content count towards Data Storage:

The system administrator has created a new custom object and application. This individual now needs to populate the new object with 1000 records, which are formatted in a CSV file. The Import Wizard (Data Management --> Import Custom Objects) is appropriate for this task.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The Salesforce Data Import Wizard allows you to import data for many standard Salesforce objects, including custom objects. It can import up to 50,000 records at a time.

questions.question_text: Multiple record types may be created for every tab with the exception of:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABCE
The Leads tab is associated with the Lead object, which does support multiple record types.
